name: In re Voluntary Assignment of Abner Hoge. Appeal of James Kuntz, Jr., and R. C. McConnell, Executors of James W. Kuntz, deceased
name_abbreviation: In re Voluntary Assignment of Hoge

judges: Before Green, Williams, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
parties: In re Voluntary Assignment of Abner Hoge. Appeal of James Kuntz, Jr., and R. C. McConnell, Executors of James W. Kuntz, deceased.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Dean,
All the questions raised by this appeal have been disposed of in No. 49, October term, 1898, opinion handed down herewith, ante, p. 527. The same decree is made as in that case. The appeal is dismissed at costs of appellants.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Dean,

casebody.head_matter:
In re Voluntary Assignment of Abner Hoge. Appeal of James Kuntz, Jr., and R. C. McConnell, Executors of James W. Kuntz, deceased.
November 14, 1898:
Argued Oct. 17, 1898.
Appeal, No. 51, Oct. Term, 1898, by James Kuntz, Jr., et ah, from order of C. P. Greene Co., Jan. T., 1890, No. 7, sustaining exceptions to auditor’s report.
Before Green, Williams, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
Affirmed.
